info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 18 at 2:53PM PST until November 19 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 7 PM THIS EVENING TO 10 AM PST SUNDAY ABOVE 4000 FEET... * WHAT...Snow accumulations of 7 to 14 inches above 4000 feet expected. Some of the highest peaks could see amounts up to 18 inches. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...The Southern Oregon Cascades from Lake of the Woods Pass on Highway 140 northward. This includes Crater Lake and Diamond Lake as well as Highway 58 at Willamette Pass, Highway 62, and Highway 138. * WHEN...From 7 PM Saturday to 10 AM PST Sunday. The heaviest snow will fall after midnight. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches and combine with snow to lower visibility. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...There`s a 70 to 80 percent chance for 1 inch per hour snowfall rates for several hours across the advisory area. Near Willamette Pass, there is a 40 to 50 percent chance for seeing 2 inch per hour snowfall rates around 4 AM. Snowfall rates will lessen Sunday morning. Overnight lows on Sunday night are expected to be in the low 20s, and flash freezing may be possible on wet roads. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See https://www.tripcheck.com or http://quickmap.dot.ca.gov for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.
